Summary Enterprise Integration Architect capable of leading IT Organizations to desired future state with best-in-class implementations using best-of-breed products available. I have solid architectural design and development experience with proven examples of driving projects to successful completion through all phases of SDLC. 
 
With primary focus on middleware, I have experience on a variety of product suites including but not limited to Oracle SOA, TIBCO, webMethods and .NET. In addition, I have worked through all aspects of middleware product life cycle including middleware product development, middleware product maintenance, middleware product support, middleware administration, presales, proof of concepts and implementations. Specialties:Enterprise Architectures, Solution Architectures, Highly Available and Fault Tolerant System Designs, Business Process Modeling with externalized Business Rules, Service Oriented Integration Architecture Frameworks, Integration Security. Experience Director, Consulting Services AOT Technologies January 2010  – Present (5 years 8 months) Vancouver, Canada Area Integration Architect MAXIMUS BC September 2008  –  January 2014  (5 years 5 months) Vancouver, Canada Area Enterprise Integration Architect responsible for Enterprise Architecture standards, frameworks and methodologies in the Integration Domain. Primary focus is on best practices implementation of Oracle Fusion Middleware stack in highly available and fault tolerant environments. 
 
Defined Enterprise Integration Patterns and Documentation Templates. Captured Enterprise Architecture in PowerDesigner. Provided Thought Leadership on usage patterns of almost every Enterprise Technology tools and assets. Involved in evaluation and proof of concepts for various vendor product selections. Worked closely with CIO, Enterprise Architect, Solution Architects and external business partners to make sure the solutions developed adhere to Enterprise Standards. Rationalized a Middleware Web Service Design Philosophy and made recommendations to functional projects. Defined a highly available and fault tolerant Infrastructure Topology for Oracle Fusion Middleware components. Worked closely with Infrastructure and Middleware Administration personnel to make sure clustered environments work as expected. 
 
Solution Architected SOA based business process automation framework that makes use of Oracle BPEL (Orchestration), Oracle Service Bus (Service Virtualization) and AION RM (Business Rules Engine). Prototyped several integration patterns and passed the same to development and middleware administration teams for immediate use in projects. This includes Asynchronous Business Processes using BPEL that fails over successfully with the existing clustering architecture, Java Messaging Service (JMS) singleton (WebLogic Service migration) failover, WS-Security Policy usage with Oracle Service Bus, WS-Security and WS-Addressing approaches in different layers of Oracle middleware stack, asynchronous callback integrations with Oracle Data Integrator etc. 
 
Implementation Specialist in 11g FMW/SOA (SCA, BPEL, Mediator, Business Rules, Human Workflow, OSB, JCA Adapters, B2B, ODI, BAM, Enterprise Manager) SOA Architect Medtronic February 2007  –  September 2008  (1 year 8 months) Performed the role of Enterprise SOA Architect at Medtronic (World’s largest medical devices manufacturing company) collaborating with multiple Medtronic business units. Architected and led SOA based integrations for various business units.  
 
For Spinal business unit the SOA integration was done to Orchestrate Siebel Web Services into meaningful composite business services to be consumed by My Spine Tools (Surgeon and Event Management Portal). Also designed and developed SOA Interfaces for integrating Amex Travel bookings to Siebel. 
 
Device And Registrant Tracking (DART) was another Oracle SOA based integration project to automate tracking and registration of Medtronic devices implanted on patients. The whole Electronic Registration Business Process was designed using Oracle BPEL and Oracle ESB, keeping the business logic in BPEL and the routing/transformations in ESB. 
 
Created SOA Integration Solution Architectures. Implemented best practices in service orchestration design. Installed and configured Oracle SOA suite. Designed and developed Oracle BPEL flows. Implemented robust BPEL error handler flows. Designed and developed Oracle ESB processes for transformations and routing. Implemented WS Security in BPEL and ESB layers. Implemented WS Security authorization integration with Enterprise IDM (SiteMinder). SOA Integration Technical Consultant Midwave Corporation November 2006  –  September 2008  (1 year 11 months) Worked as a Technical Consultant for Midwave Corporation. Partnered with Oracle in multiple pre sales activities for various clients in Twin Cities. Clients that I engaged include Medtronic, Connexus Energy, The TileShop, University Of Minnesota, Michelina's and Dairy Queen.  
 
Responsiblities included preparing pre sales presentation and technical materials for Proof of Concept (POC) projects, visiting customer sites and Oracle sales office to present solution offerings, implementation of SOA integration solutions at customer sites. Oracle SOA Architect The Tile Shop November 2006  –  February 2007  (4 months) Greater Minneapolis-St. Paul Area Designed and implemented Oracle SOA based integration solution for integrating Tile Shop Point of Sales (POS) to J D Edwards ERP backend system.  
 
Created SOA Integration Blueprint based on requirements. Installed and configured Oracle SOA suite and J D Edwards Adapter. Created ASP.NET Web services for SQL server data processing. Configured Adapter Service (JCA) Interfaces to call J D Edwards business functions. Designed and developed Oracle BPEL flows for Sales Order processing consuming .NET Web services and J D Edwards Adapter services. Designed XML Schema and WSDLs for various interfaces. Designed complex XSL Transformations. TIBCO Consultant PepsiCo June 2006  –  November 2006  (6 months) Performed the role of TIBCO Infrastructure Admin being part of TIBCO Infrastructure Integration and Administration team at PepsiCo. 
 
Responsiblities included the following. 
 
Set up TIBCO infrastructure for integration, fault tolerance, administration and monitoring. Handle TIBCO rollouts and upgrades in test, preproduction and production environments. Investigate and analyze TIBCO issues reported by application integration teams. Interface and follow up with TIBCO Support for outstanding issues. Troubleshoot TIBCO EMS(JMS) integration issues faced by application development teams. Participate in planning and execution of TIBCO Disaster Recovery and High Availability tests. TIBCO Support Engineer TIBCO Software September 2005  –  June 2006  (10 months) Worked as a Partner (Infosys) Support Engineer in TIBCO Global Support team, supporting 8 TIBCO adapters. Responsibilities included simulating issues reported by customers, analyzing customer environment and integration through WebEx sessions, working closely with internal support and engineering teams to resolve adapter integration issues with other TIBCO products like TIBCO BusinessWorks and TIBCO Administrator. Suggested architectural guidelines to TIBCO Professional Service Group to achieve fault tolerance, scalability, load balancing, monitoring and security goals in integration scenarios involving adapters. Software Engineer Infosys Technologies September 2003  –  September 2005  (2 years 1 month) Infosys had a partnership with TIBCO to develop, maintain and support TIBCO Application Adapters. Being part of TIBCO Engineering, worked as the Primary Development Engineer for TIBCO Adapter for Lotus Notes using Java SDK. Involved in various in-house EAI research activities in parallel to the work in Adapter Development. Achieved expertise on Web Services and Web Services Orchestration. Helped Oracle Corporation to leverage BPEL on EAI space by working on a Proof of Concept Project which involves multiple EAI Products and Oracle BPEL Process Manager. This has been published by Oracle in Oracle Technology Network and also by PACKT Publishing. Senior Tibco BPM/SOA Consultant at ASML ASML November 2011  –  June 2014  (2 years 8 months) Eindhoven Area, Netherlands Development of Activematrix BPM flows as part of a company wide program to improve the approval processes within ASML.Casting the approval processes into a BPM flow improves the traceability, auditability and measurability of the approval processes. The BPM process also enforces the proper approvals for each request, and allows manager to give approvals while traveling abroad, reducing the average time spend on the process. 
 
My work here includes among others: 
The IT project authorisation process, or PAF, used to obtain commitment and budget for any IT project within ASML. 
The Contract Management process, to assist sales to follow up on expiring customer contracts.

Tibco BPM Consultant Essent September 2009  –  November 2011  (2 years 3 months) The Essent Greenfield project is a replacement of the complete customer service software at Essent. The inhouse bank of Essent regulates the intra-company payments. The business-units no longer use an external bank for internal transactions, but keep their liquid assets inhouse while remaining fully auditable and complying to the strict financial regulations. The Tibco software is used for the transactions with external parties, communicating with the banks over secure lines.
